title: Attachment with very long filename pushes action buttons out of window
content:
When a message arrives with an attachment that has a very long filename, the header section at the top of the message pane is also expanded to the length of the filename. This causes the actions buttons to be pushed off of the header section.

Here are two screenshots that show this. The first is the attachment section at the bottom of the message pane, the second is the header section.

title: Can't Add any email accounts to Thunderbird
content: I am trying to add my first email account to Thunderbird (a Gmail account). I can complete the entire process, even verification with Google, but then I get an error message "unable to log in at server". I have adjusted cookie settings and several other ideas from the help info. Is there anyone who can direct me?

title: Thunderbird doesn't scale on high DPI displays, needs Windows compatibility mode which resets on every update
content:
On my Microsoft Surface Pro 7 running Windows 11 Thunderbird starts out very small and I set the high DPI compatibility mode on thunderbird.exe to System to fix this. The really annoying part is that every time Thunderbird updates (which seems fairly frequent) I lose that setting and have to do it over. Firefox does not have this issue.

Can Thunderbird fix it's high DPI display once and for all?
creator: sprior1

title: Supernova window unresponsive during mailbox updates - single threaded?
content: Since the Supernova update I notice that Thunderbird isn't responsive to UI interactions while it is fetching emails from accounts, this was not at all the case with the previous versions. Is the code using the same thread for UI and fetching? This new behavior isn't great user experience.

title: Get rid of yellow diamond to left of Subject
content:
How do I get rid of the useless yellow diamonds to the left of the subject? It appears to do nothing but show "READ status" The email is bold if it is unopened. The undescernable stupid green spot to the right of the subject also indicate READ status.

STOP making changes with no purpose but to confuse us and piss us off.

Get the menu bar back where it belongs.

Put the search bar back where is relates to the subject and address of the email.

Why does the search bar say Ctrl + K ?

What is with all of the new clutter that appears to have no purpose?

The faint gray Search... is a contrast violation of WCAG.

I know I am complaining to the wall but .......

title: How to adjust  and save  display settings please?
content:
Hello

The 'new' Thunderbird installed itself on my PC yesterday BUT the list of messages has become hard to read as a result. I can't quite tell why this is - it might be the typeface has changed or the font size has decreased by default. The whole page seems less clear. This must be a universal change as I noticed it on my business account on a different PC as well.

I tried to resolve it myself, I went into 'settings' and altered the typeface & size but couldn't see what I needed to do to 'save' my changes.

Can you tell me please how to 'save' the changes I tried? OR How I can go back to the previous appearance?

I'm sorry I can't show how it looked before to show a proper comparison or explain the difference in more detail but it IS different.

Thank you for any advice you can offer.

title: Thunderbird bugs
content: Thunderbird has been my mailer for more than 15 years. The latest incarnation Supernova is awfully buggy. I installed version 102.3.3 in early October and since then had lots of grief. Updating to 115.3.2 on Oct 13 and to 115.3.3 today did nothing to improve things. The program suffers lots of freezes and is just not functioning well. I tried to file this report from within T-bird following Settings -> General -> Release notes (under Updates) -> file a bug in Bugzilla and ended up with an empty, unresponsive page (see attached). There appears to be something very fundamental that needs to be fixed.

title: Restoring from a PCV
content:
Some malware blew right through my security and ended up munging the MBR. I had to rebuild the partition and reinstall Windows.

Since my backup is online and constant to the cloud, the only profile version I have is one that's destroyed. This leaves me having to restore from a Mozbackup .pcv file. I d/l the current backup program but it looks for a .bak file. Using Mozbackup to restore the .pcv seemed to run all right but didn't restore my T'bird to that backup profile. That is, the Restore seemed to run fine but did not write anything to AppData/Local/Thunderbird.

How can I restore my profile from this .pcv file? I'm desperate.
creator: paul.cassel

title: Get emails for a specific account, not all of them at the same time
content:
Hi everyone. I am a Thunderbird user since it was first introduced way back when... I just migrated all my info from my trusty Windows 7 to a new Windows 10 machine and installed the latest version of Tbird. I have several accounts in my Tbird list. None of them are set to automatically download emails from the server. In my previous Tbird version, I used to be able to click on the name of an account and then (at the top of the screen) "Get messages" and it would only get messages for that particular account. Now it downloads the emails for all my accounts which I do not want. How can I change it to only get messages for the account I have clicked on in the accounts list ?

My second question concerns the font and size of the messages in the right hand pane. i.e. when I click on a particular account's "Inbox" on the left, I see a list of the emails received on the right, but the font is too small and is not the font I used to have on my Windows 7 (Arial). I have played around with the Windows settings but it has not changed anything in Tbird. So how do I change the display font and size in Tbird ? (NOT the font used to write emails)
creator: Helvetica

creator: abierre661

title: Bloqueo de IP
content:
Tal vez sea una coincidencia pero nunca tuvimos un problema mientras tuvimos instalado W7 durante bastante tiempo, luego pasamos a W10 también sin inconvenientes y a principios de este año, a partir de instalar Windows 11, cuando inicio Thunderbird chequea si hay correo nuevo, si hay lo descarga PERO A LOS POCOS MINUTOS DEJA DE FUNCIONAR, ya no me permite enviar correo ni chequear si hay correo nuevo. Lo particular del caso es que a partir de ese momento, además de no poder usar Thunderbird TAMPOCO ME PERMITE INGRESAR AL PANEL DE CONTROL DE MI SERVIDOR DE HOSTING. Al consultar el tema con el personal de soporte del servidor nos indican que nuestro IP se encuentra bloqueado PERO LO UNICO QUE NO PUEDO HACER ES USAR THUNDERBIRD. Mi modem sigue funcionando normalmente y PUEDO SEGUIR NAVEGANDO SIN NINGUN INCONVENIENTE, consultando páginas, enviando y recibiendo correo por Gmail, etc. LO UNICO QUE NO PUEDO HACER ES USAR THUNDERBIRD. Cuando intento enviar arroja este mensaje:

Falló el envío del mensaje. El mensaje no se ha podido enviar porque ha fallado la conexión al servidor de salida (SMTP) mail.elpodiodeportes.com.ar. El servidor puede no estar disponible o está rechazando conexiones SMTP. Verifique que los ajustes de su servidor de salida (SMTP) son correctos y vuelva a intentarlo

Esto ocurre en las dos PC que tenemos instaladas en nuestra oficina con W11. En la que utilizo en mi domicilio particular todavía tengo Windows 7 y sigo usando Thunderbird en el que tengo configurada la misma dirección de correo que en la oficina y en esa PC descarga y envía correos sin ningún inconveniente. ALGUIEN TIENE REMOTA IDEA DE QUE PUEDE ESTAR PROVOCANDO ESTE INCONVENIENTE?
creator: lusero49

title: unread message count on intermediate folders does not show when moving messages via automated rules to a sub of a sub folder (3 levels down)
content:
When I receive email messages, the inbox folder correctly shows the unread/new message count (colored)

When a message filter runs on the unread message and moves it to a sub of a sub folder, the top level still correctly shows the unread count (now in gray), the sub folder does not show anything, and the sub-sub folder (with the actual message) shows the unread count in correct colored fashion. This is wrong, the sub folder should also show the unread count (in gray).

Strangely enough, marking a message unread in a sub-sub folder correctly updates the unread count on all levels (top, sub and sub-sub folder) in gray color

The problem with the above is that for new messages, opening the top folder shows you the sub folders without any unread count, so you basically have to open them all to find the sub-sub folder that has the actual unread message.
creator: luc.verhoeven

title: Thunderbird 115.3.3
content:

Um ótimo dia a todos.

title: when I click on individual mail in search results it opens the whole thread not just the mail I want
content:
First step is that I type text into the search field and press return. A new tab opens with previews of the emails that the search has found. I click on the header of the email which I can see is the one I want. At that point, that email should open, it used to. Now, when I do that I get another tab showing one entry which is the first email in what Thunderbird has decided is one thread (not necessarily the same subject line). I have to then open the thread up which gives me a list (no previews) so I have to go back to the previous tab and look at the date on the email I want, then back to the latest tab and select the one with the correct date (of which there may be many) and finally I see the email I wanted to see 5 clicks earlier.

I would like it to be fixed so that when I select an email preview, that email is displayed, like it used to.

title: From name not updated for incoming email
content:
I have a number of contacts where the email address reflects the person's position. Over time the person in this position has changed. Even though I have edited the contact to show the new person's name any incoming email still shows as from the old person.

For example Joe Blogs contact has email director@abc.com We receive lots of email in Thunderbird from Joe. The contact changes so that now Martha Jenkins now uses director@abc.com Now we receive emails from Martha but they still show as coming from Joe Blogs. There does not appear to be anything in the header that refers to Joe Blogs. The header only includes director@abc.com and Thunderbird somehow looks up old email and shows it as coming from Joe Blogs even though this is no longer true.

It is really annoying.

I hope I have explained this well enough.

Regards Drew

title: Reverting back to 102 from 115 is not sticking. —  What do I need to do?
content:
115 is awful. I want out. I have deleted it. Emptied Trash. (mac) I only use Thunderbird for mail, no plugins, nothing fancy. I re-downloaded 102.15 (not beta).

I followed the instructions on this web page to use "about:profiles" set my 24 GB folder as default. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

> Set as default profile This option allows you to switch profiles. > Click this to make Thunderbird use this profile by default at startup.

Then I used Terminal as described to select the same profile to launch at startup.

> In the Terminal application, enter the following: > /Applications/Thunderbird.app/Contents/MacOS/thunderbird-bin -P

I launch Thunderbird 102.15 (not beta) and I always get the alert - "You have launched an older version of Thunderbird." The only option is to create a new, empty, profile, or Quit.

So there's something else I need to get rid of. Something else that needs to be removed / fixed / done to get 102 to open what 102 opened less than a week ago, before I downloaded 115 and SHTF.

Since 115 _instantly_ opened the profile from 102, I know there was NO extensive conversion, no migrating all the content to some new paradigm. It was instant, and all 24 GB was there.

So I want to un-instant whatever 115 did and go back to 102. How do I do that?

Do I need to text-edit some data file with a version number so that 102 accepts all 24 GB of data as it did before? I'm happy to do it. Just tell me what to do.
